title: Pronouns: Weak Forms (Me, Se, Ton)
reading_greek:
THE SHORT FORMS
1. Με (Me) - Με ξέρεις; (Do you know me?)
2. Σε (You) - Σε βλέπω. (I see you)
3. Τον (Him) - Τον αγαπάω. (I love him)
4. Την (Her) - Την ξέρω. (I know her)
5. Το (It) - Το θέλω. (I want it)

PLURAL
- Μας (Us) - Μας βλέπει.
- Σας (You pl) - Σας ακούω.
- Τους (Them m) / Τις (Them f) / Τα (Them n).

POSITION
- Short pronouns go BEFORE the verb!
- 'Se thelo' (I want you).
reading_english:
GRAMMAR: PERSONAL PRONOUNS (Page 83)

1. WEAK vs STRONG:
   - Strong: Emena (Me). Used for emphasis.
   - Weak: Me (Me). Used 90% of the time.

2. WORD ORDER:
   - Unlike English (I see YOU - after),
   - Greek puts it BEFORE.
   - 'Se vlepo' (You I-see).
   - 'Ton xero' (Him I-know).
audio_script:
Pronouns. Short words, huge importance. 

In English we say 'I love YOU'. 
In Greek we say 'S'agapao' (You I-love). 
The pronoun comes BEFORE the verb.

'Me' -> Me.
'Se' -> You.
'Ton' -> Him.
'Tin' -> Her.
'To' -> It.

'Ton vlepo'. I see him.
'Tin vlepo'. I see her.

If you want to emphasize 'I love YOU (and not her)', use the Strong form 'Esena'. 
'Esena agapao'. 
But normally: 'S'agapao'.
